meanings.definition: To a very great degree or extent
meanings.sent1: She exceedingly enjoyed the movie last night.
meanings.sent2: The students worked exceedingly hard on their project.
meanings.sent3: The cat was exceedingly curious about the new toy.
meanings.sent4: His kindness exceeded all expectations, making him exceedingly popular.
meanings.sent5: The storm grew exceedingly fierce as the night went on.

meanings.sent1: The weather was exceedingly hot during the summer.
meanings.sent2: The mountain climber was exceedingly tired after reaching the summit.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was exceedingly excited to see the colorful balloons.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was exceedingly bright, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The cake was exceedingly delicious, leaving everyone wanting more.

meanings.definition: In a manner that surpasses what is normal or expected
meanings.sent1: The magician performed exceedingly well at the talent show.
meanings.sent2: The athlete ran exceedingly fast, breaking the record.
meanings.sent3: The plant grew exceedingly tall in just a few weeks.
meanings.sent4: Her intelligence was exceedingly sharp, solving the puzzle in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice was exceedingly powerful, captivating the audience.
